description.narrative: (Democratic Republic of the Congo): C-Change is a social and behavioral change communication (SBCC) activity increasing positive health behaviors through evidence-based programming. C-Change improves coordination, participation, and country ownership of national health programs by facilitating SBCC technical working groups to plan and implement national programming and building host country and implementing partner skills to design, implement, and evaluate SBCC programs, resulting in more effective and sustainable programming. C-Change addresses behaviors related to malaria, MNCH, WASH, FP, TB, and GBV to increase positive health behaviors and equitable access to health care. In FY 2014, it will emphasize the integration of SBCC programming across sectors and work with the MOH to develop a national HIV communication strategy. C-Change will also support the national FP coordination group during this critical early stage in implementation of the new FP National Strategy 2014-2020.
